name: Intro to DataShare and the ISU Digital Repository
description: Do you want your research to be read by as many people as possible? Do you need to comply with federal requirements for making your scholarship and data publically available? The library can help! In this workshop, we'll cover how ISU's open access respositories--DataShare and and the Digital Repository--can help ISU faculty, students, and staff share and perserve paper and data publications. You'll learn how to add publications to these systems and about benefits, like tracking statistics, stable links, and author profiles.

name: Intro to ArcGIS Online Map Viewer
description: Participants in this workshops will get an introduction to ArcGIS Map Viewer and the basic concepts, data sources, and tools for mapping and spatial analysis. Participants will get hands-on experience and create a map using ArcGIS Online.

name: Data Viz 101: Effective Design
description: Join us for a one-hour seminar focused on creating effective and appealing data visualizations. Participants will learn how design choices can make or break a data viz and how simple changes can lead to big improvements. We'll cover topics such as text and fonts, color, layout, and labels.

name: Data Viz Glow Up: Pick a Chart Type
description: In this one-hour seminar, we'll explore different chart types and when to use them to best represent your data. Participants will learn the strengths and weaknesses of various chart types, including bar charts, line graphs, scatter plots, pie charts, and more. We'll also discuss how to choose the right chart type based on the story you want to tell with your data.

name: Making Interactive Maps in Leaflet Part 1: Getting Started
description: Learn how to use Leaflet - an open-source mapping platform - to create basic maps. Google and Github accounts required.

name: Making Interactive Maps in Leaflet Part 2: Storymaps
description: Build on your Leaflet skills by learning how to create an interactive storymap. Google and Github accounts required.

name: Creating an Academic Portfolio Website with GitHub Pages
description: Join us for this hands-on workshop and learn how to create a polished, professional portfolio website for free on GitHub Pages.

name: Exploring Spatial Data with R
description: This hands-on workshop will guide you through importing, manipulating, and visualizing spatial datasets using local demographic data.

name: Introduction to QGIS
description: This workshop will introduce participants to the QGIS interface, demonstrate how to create and edit a basic data layer, and make a quick map.

name: OpenStreetMap Data Discovery
description: In this workshop, participants will learn how to download data from OpenStreetMap and import it to GIS software, as well as discuss data validity and ways to contribute to improving the OSM map.

name: Exploring Free Tools for Text Analysis
description: In this hands-on workshop, participants will explore two free tools for text analysis: AntConc for concordancing and n-gram analysis and Voyant Tools for a range of analysis and visualization methods.
